resources.string: Lazysodium is an effortless and easy-to-use open-source cryptography library for Java and Android. It\'s based on Libsodium, which is an excellent audited open-source C cryptography library. \n\nThis app\'s purpose is to show you the capabilities of Lazysodium for Android and Libsodium.
Symmetric key encryption means that you encrypt and decrypt a message using one key. It\'s faster and less complicated than asymmetric key encryption, which usually requires at least 4 keys.

Asymmetric key encryption means you can encrypt using a public-private keypair. You can publish your keypair\'s public key to anyone and they can use it to encrypt messages to you, which only you can decrypt.
Generic hashing hashes a given string or a file. You can supply a key making a deterministic hash too.
Using Argon2, we can securely hash a password. Use this instead of Generic Hashing to create theoretically unbreakable password hashes.
You can create several subkeys from one master key. This can help with key organisation, and in some cases, security.
